decks.notes: The main concept of this UR Aggro deck is to quickly play out low-cost aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Slickshot Show-Off, supplemented by burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart to keep the pressure on the opponent. Key cards like Dragon's Rage Channeler help generate card advantage while Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration provide card selection and deck manipulation. The deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently, utilizing cards like Mutagenic Growth and Violent Urge to push through blockers and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck focuses on generating a large amount of mana quickly by utilizing spells like Desperate Ritual, Ruby Medallion, and Pyretic Ritual. Once enough mana is generated, the player can cast powerful spells like Ral, Monsoon Mage, Past in Flames, and Glimpse the Impossible to combo off and deal a large amount of damage to their opponent. The deck also includes cards like Reckless Impulse and Wish to help find key pieces of the combo. It aims to win the game through a quick and explosive combo turn.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to aggressively attack the opponent with a combination of powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah, while also utilizing spell cards like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to deal additional damage. The deck also includes cards like Arena of Glory and Static Prison to control the battlefield and protect your creatures. Overall, the strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and efficient creatures and spells to secure a quick victory.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressive plays to quickly pressure the opponent. With a mix of powerful creatures like Phlage, Goblin Bombardment for direct damage, and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah for card advantage, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents early on. The deck also includes control elements like Static Prison and Guided Souls to disrupt the opponent's game plan. By combining these aggressive and disruptive elements, the deck aims to finish games quickly before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck focuses on a fast-paced aggressive strategy, utilizing a diverse range of creature cards and burn spells to overwhelm the opponent quickly. The key strategy is to deploy powerful threats like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Scion of Draco while using spells like Lightning Bolt and Tribal Flames to control the board and burn the opponent's life total. Leyline Binding and Leyline of the Guildpact provide protection and disruption against opposing strategies, making it difficult for the opponent to effectively counter the onslaught of creatures and spells from this aggressive deck.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to play powerful Eldrazi creatures and control the game through board wipes and disruption spells. The goal is to establish a dominant board presence with large threats like Emrakul, the Promised End and Ugin, the Eye of the Storms while using cards like Malevolent Rumble and All Is Dust to clear the opponent's board. Karn, the Great Creator provides additional utility and disruption, while Ancient Stirrings helps to find key pieces of the combo. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with Eldrazi creatures and powerful control elements.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly assemble a powerful combo using cards like Goblin Charbelcher and Boggart Trawler, along with various rituals and spells to generate mana and deal damage. The deck aims to win without relying on traditional lands, instead focusing on casting spells and activating abilities to achieve victory. It also includes disruptive elements like Blood Moon and Pact of Negation to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect its own combo. This deck is designed to be aggressive and efficient in quickly finishing the game.

The deck focuses on utilizing small, aggressive creatures coupled with direct damage spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By combining cheap spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart with creature cards that benefit from casting spells like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Monastery Swiftspear, the deck aims to maintain a fast pace and apply constant pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of card filtering spells like Preordain and Mishra's Bauble helps ensure that the deck maintains consistency and can keep up the aggression throughout the match.

This deck focuses on aggressively playing powerful creatures and using direct damage spells to control the board and pressure the opponent. By utilizing cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah, Guide of Souls, and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, the deck aims to quickly build a threatening board presence. Cards like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment help to remove threats and deal damage to the opponent. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with early aggression and efficient removal spells to secure a quick victory.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on playing aggressively with a combination of powerful creatures and removal spells. The deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with efficient threats like Ajani, Guide of Souls, and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury while controlling the board with Goblin Bombardment and Elegant Parlor. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Static Prison and Thraben Charm to disrupt the opponent's game plan. By combining aggression with disruption, this deck aims to win the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck focuses on assembling the Allosaurus Combo, using cards like Neoform, Eldritch Evolution, and Summoner's Pact to quickly find and play Allosaurus Rider and Chancellor of the Tangle. By sacrificing creatures like Autochthon Wurm, players can cascade into huge powerhouse creatures like Griselbrand and Endurance. The deck also includes protection with Pact of Negation and disruption with cards like Noxious Revival. It aims to quickly overwhelm opponents with powerful creatures and combos, while also utilizing mana ramp and card selection to ensure consistency and efficiency.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressive plays and overwhelming the opponent with a mix of creatures and burn spells. Utilizing cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, the deck aims to apply pressure early on and close out the game quickly. With cards like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment for additional reach, along with powerful planeswalkers like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah, the deck is designed to be fast-paced and proactive, aiming to outpace and outdamage the opponent before they can stabilize.

This deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures like Ketramose, the New Dawn and Emperor of Bones to pressure the opponent while disrupting their game plan with cards like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize. The deck also contains flicker effects such as Ephemerate and Flickerwisp to generate value from enter-the-battlefield effects. Additionally, the deck includes graveyard hate in the form of Relic of Progenitus to deal with opposing graveyard strategies. Overall, the deck aims to win through a combination of efficient creatures, disruption, and board control.

This deck focuses on assembling the Allosaurus Combo, which involves using cards like Neoform and Eldritch Evolution to search for and play Allosaurus Rider. By discarding Autochthon Wurm or Griselbrand with Nourishing Shoal, players can gain enough life to survive the summoning sickness of Allosaurus Rider and attack for lethal damage. The deck also includes cards like Chancellor of the Tangle and Disciple of Freyalise to ramp up mana quickly and enable the combo to be executed as early as possible. The inclusion of cards like Pact of Negation and Noxious Revival help protect and maintain the combo once it is assembled.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on low-cost, high-value creatures and spells to quickly overwhelm opponents. The deck includes powerful cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury to apply pressure early on. The inclusion of Guide of Souls and Ocelot Pride helps to maintain a steady stream of threats. Arena of Glory provides additional support by boosting creatures and providing a way to protect them. With a mix of aggression and control elements, this deck aims to swiftly defeat opponents before they have a chance to stabilize.

This deck focuses on quickly emptying your hand to power out big threats like Hollow One and Detective's Phoenix. Utilizing cards like Burning Inquiry and Goblin Lore to cycle through your deck and get your big threats onto the battlefield quickly. With a mix of aggressive creatures and burn spells, the goal is to overwhelm your opponent with fast, powerful creatures and direct damage. The deck also includes some control elements with Nethergoyf and Arena of Glory, allowing for some flexibility in dealing with opponents' strategies.

This deck focuses on utilizing The Underworld Cookbook along with other artifact and graveyard synergies to create a fast and aggressive playstyle. By using cards like Ovalchase Daredevil and Psychic Frog, the deck aims to quickly disrupt the opponent's strategy while building up its own resources. With plenty of ways to fetch and recycle key cards, the deck can maintain pressure and adapt to different matchups effectively. The combination of aggro tactics and graveyard manipulation makes this deck a versatile and challenging opponent in the Modern format.

The main concept of this deck is to control the board and disrupt your opponent's game plan by using removal spells and disruptive creatures like Flickerwisp and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd. Additionally, the deck aims to pressure the opponent with aggressive creatures like Emperor of Bones and Overlord of the Balemurk. The deck also includes graveyard hate with Relic of Progenitus and efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Prismatic Ending. The mana base is built to support the deck's color requirements and to maximize consistency in casting spells.

This deck focuses on utilizing a variety of creature toolbox options to generate value and control the game. By utilizing cards like Chord of Calling and Green Sun's Zenith, the deck can tutor for specific creatures to fit the situation. Combo pieces like Cauldron Familiar and Witch's Oven can create a loop to gain incremental advantage, while cards like Viscera Seer and Yawgmoth, Thran Physician provide sacrifice outlets for value. The deck also includes disruption elements like Malevolent Rumble and removal options like Brightglass Gearhulk to control the board and protect its combo pieces.

This deck focuses on ramping up to high-cost Eldrazi creatures while using control elements to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The key strategy is to accelerate mana production with Utopia Sprawl and Eldrazi Temple in order to play powerful threats like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker ahead of schedule. Control elements like Kozilek's Return and Malevolent Rumble help to manage the board state and protect your creatures while maximizing the advantage gained from ramping. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with massive Eldrazi creatures while controlling the game to achieve victory.

This deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. By using cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to disrupt the opponent's hand and board, the deck can clear the way for its own creatures to attack. The deck also utilizes flicker effects like Ephemerate and Flickerwisp to generate extra value from creature abilities. The combination of aggressive creatures and disruption spells allows the deck to control the game tempo and overwhelm the opponent.

The deck revolves around utilizing lands and mana ramp to quickly and efficiently play powerful creatures such as Primeval Titan and Cultivator Colossus, while also utilizing the land synergies of Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and Amulet of Vigor to deal damage to the opponent. The key strategy involves assembling the Amulet Titan combo pieces to generate explosive plays and overwhelm the opponent with big creatures and land-based synergies. By utilizing the deck's ability to quickly search for key pieces and ramp up mana, the player aims to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent for a decisive victory.

The deck focuses on quickly and aggressively putting out artifact creatures and using various artifacts to generate value and disrupt opponents. By combining efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Cori-Steel Cutter with powerful artifact cards like Mox Opal and Urza's Saga, the deck can overwhelm opponents early in the game. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card advantage while Emry, Lurker of the Loch allows for recursion of key artifacts. Additionally, cards like Galvanic Blast and Lava Dart provide direct damage to finish off opponents. Overall, the deck aims to quickly establish a board presence and outpace opponents.

This deck focuses on quickly assembling a combo without relying on lands. Using cards like Bitter Reunion, Manamorphose, and Desperate Ritual to generate mana, the goal is to play powerful spells like Irencrag Feat and Sundering Eruption. Pinnacle Monk and Stormscale Scion help to generate additional mana, while cards like Valakut Awakening provide card draw. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Blood Moon and Spikefield Hazard. The end goal is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a strong combo finish using Goblin Charbelcher.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay with a mix of creatures and spells to deal damage quickly to the opponent. By utilizing a combination of efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Territorial Kavu, as well as powerful burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Tribal Flames, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent quickly before they have a chance to stabilize. Additionally, Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding provide support to protect your creatures and prevent the opponent from mounting a defense, while cards like Scion of Draco and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury can quickly close out the game.

The deck focuses on quickly assembling a win condition using a combination of artifacts and spells. By utilizing various counterspells and disruptive spells, it aims to protect its key combo pieces and maintain control of the game until it can go off with cards like Goblin Charbelcher or Thundertrap Trainer. The deck also includes card draw and tutor effects to dig for its combo pieces. Overall, the strategy revolves around creating a powerful board state and overwhelming the opponent with a game-winning combo without relying on traditional lands.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. The key strategy is to efficiently utilize low-cost creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls to deal damage early on, while also using burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to finish off the opponent. The inclusion of powerful cards like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah provides additional threats and ways to push through damage. The deck aims to maintain pressure and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck focuses on generating mana quickly through rituals and mana-producing spells to cast powerful, game-winning spells like Ral, Monsoon Mage and Glimpse the Impossible. By using card draw and recursion effects like Past in Flames, the deck aims to create explosive turns where multiple spells can be cast in succession. The combo potential with cards like Grapeshot and Artist's Talent allows the deck to deal massive amounts of damage in a single turn, overwhelming the opponent. By efficiently chaining spells together, this deck aims to quickly close out games before the opponent can react.

The deck focuses on using creatures with sacrifice abilities to generate value and control the board while assembling combinations that can lead to game-winning plays. By tutoring creatures with Chord of Calling and using sacrifice outlets like Viscera Seer and Carrion Feeder, the deck can create loops with Cauldron Familiar and Yawgmoth, Thran Physician for incremental advantage or close out the game with Marionette Apprentice. The toolbox nature of the deck allows for flexibility in responding to different situations and adapting to various matchups.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game using the UrzaTron lands to quickly ramp up into powerful Eldrazi creatures like Ulamog and Thought-Knot Seer. Trinisphere and Karn, the Great Creator work together to disrupt your opponent's strategy, while Ugin and other colorless spells provide additional control and removal options. The deck looks to quickly establish a dominant board presence with these powerful threats and control elements, overwhelming the opponent with efficient plays and potent threats.

The main concept of the deck is to quickly put pressure on the opponent by deploying aggressive Eldrazi creatures and disrupting their game plan with cards like Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer. The deck focuses on mana acceleration with lands like Eldrazi Temple and Cavern of Souls to cast powerful threats like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon. The deck also has elements of control with cards like Kozilek's Command and Sowing Mycospawn to remove threats and generate card advantage. Overall, the deck seeks to overwhelm the opponent with fast, powerful creatures and disruptive plays.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggression and quick creature plays to overwhelm the opponent. By using powerful creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, along with support cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Goblin Bombardment, the deck aims to deal damage fast and efficiently. The inclusion of control elements like Static Prison and Thraben Charm helps to disrupt the opponent's strategy while continuing to apply pressure. Additionally, the versatile land base allows for consistent mana access to keep up the aggressive gameplay.
